> [[ UI Messenger â€“ Ayla ]]
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Ayla, are you there? I just got a couple of consultations done, and the results were a little bit weird.
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Oh, are we interested in the lore now? ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Ha ha. Are you busy?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Very, actually. Can you access the message boards? ))

You check.

> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Nope, why?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( God damnit. There was a battle in the tavern. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( A rogue Tech detonated a fractalline array bomb, claiming it was to 'disperse the fighting'. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( It killed four Nameless, two other players, did enough damage to take down the NPC bartender... ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: What? Holy shit.
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( That's not the worst part. It destroyed the message board server. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Yeah, I was thinking earlier: should that really be in the tavern?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Fuck no. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( If we can get another one online, we're putting it in the Guardians' guild hall. But, I've cannibalized everything I could, and it doesn't look like that's happening for a while. Information flow regarding new items and the dungeon branches has gone full stop, and city-wide communication is a pipe-dream, even with the ansible. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: Seriously? What do you need?
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( Luck, or interference to the tune of Celestial Gems. A cursory look at the parts reveals that these things are made of stuff we haven't discovered yet. Like Unique Identifiers. ))
> [[ Ayla ]]: (( If you want to talk lore, I'll be at the Hall later, or you can go find Dorian there now. He'll chat you up if it's really that important. ))
> [[ Ascheritte ]]: You were the one down in the ruins with me. I doubt anyone else would get it.

There's no further response for a bit.

> Message Aelriss or Tatsumaki and find out where they've gone.
> Head for the guild halls. You could talk to Dorian, wait for Ayla, or knock on the Guardians' door.
> Continue to the city center.
